Training package¶

xnn.training.loop module¶

class xnn.training.loop.Loop(trainer, learndata=[], validdata=[], metricsdict={}, url=None, savefilenamecsv=None, weightdict={}, printflag=True, plotmetricmean=True, savemodelnamebase=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

An example training loop. The trainer will learn from learndata, apply metrics to validdata, plot to bokeh server at url if supplied, and save to csv file.

Parameters:
  • trainer – The trainer to run
  • learndata – A list of generator functions that yield batches of data from which the trainer will learn
  • validdata – A list of generator functions that yield batches of data to which the metrics will be applied
  • metricsdict – A dictionary of metrics to apply to the validdata. The keys of metricsdict are the keys in the model.predict output from which the metric should be calculated
  • url – A string representing the url where the bokeh server is running (e.g. http://127.0.0.1:5006). If None, or if server cannot be connected, no plotting will occur
  • savefilenamecsv – The name of a file into which to write metric results at each epoch.
  • weightdict – Dictionary of Weighters. Keys in weightdict are keys into which the weight results will be inserted in the data dictionary. Weights are calculated for every training batch.
  • printflag – Whether to print results to stdout after each epoch
  • plotmetricmean – Whether to print/save/plot mean of all metrics. Depending on the metrics, this value might not make sense.
  • savemodelnamebase – Base name for saving metrics. If not None, models will be saved for the best values of each metric as looping procedes.

Methods

bind_global_update(update_settings, overwrite=False)[source]¶
bind_regularization(penalty, lnamelist=None)[source]¶

Attach a regularization penalty to a list of layers.

Parameters:
  • penalty – a theano expression compatible with lasagne.regularization.apply_penalty
  • lnamelist – a list of layer names to which this regularization should apply. If None, all layers in the model will be added. If a list of tuples, specify regularization coefficents: [(lname,coeff),...]. If a float, all layers will be added with the float as a coefficient
